means: Fellow of the Institution of Radio Engineers 无线电工程师协会会员
Fairchild integrated real-time executive 仙童综合实时执行程序
flight investigation reentry environment 再入大气层环境飞行研究
flexible intelligent route engine 灵活智能路由引擎

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"解雇，开除"之意。
means: discharge ： 语气较重，指有理由的解雇，含几乎不再复用的意味。
dismiss ： 正式用词，是这组词中语气最轻的一个词，一般只有从上文才能看解雇的原因或理由。
fire ： 口语用词，多指被断然地突然解雇，其行动犹如开枪一样干净利落。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"点燃，着火"之意。
means: kindle ： 指艰难或缓慢地把可燃料点燃，可用于比喻。
fire ： 普通用词，指将某物点燃使其燃烧起来，火势可大可小。
ignite ： 多用于科技文体，指使某物受热直到燃烧或发光，也可指用火花使易燃物迅速燃烧起来。
light ： 普通用词，指点燃易燃物，使其能发光，满足各种需要。

word_mean: 耐火连接器: fire-proof connector 在规定的时间内能耐受规定温度的火焰的连接器。
［船舶］消防设备: fighting equipment 供船上消除火灾、防止火灾蔓延以及保护消防人员用的各种器具。

sentence.Network_en: He said they should turn their fire on the Conservative Party instead.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说他们应该掉转枪口，向保守党开火。

sentence.Network_en: The council recently drew fire for its intervention in the dispute.
sentence.Network_cn: 委员会最近因为介入该起争端而遭到批评。

sentence.Network_en: If something's a sure-fire hit then Radio One will play it.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果哪首歌一定会火，那么第一频道肯定会播出。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 假面骑士Fourze_百度百科 ... 格林机关枪 Gatling 火（fire） Fire 隐身 Stealth.
火字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 火气〖 internalheat(asacauseofdisease)〗 火灾〖 fire(asadisaster);fireaccident〗 火把〖 torch〗.
法师 - 魔兽世界 - 熊猫人之谜 MOP ... 奥术 Arcane 火焰 Fire 冰霜 Frost.
矮人火枪手_百度百科 ... “Time to go!”（ 该出发了！） “Fire!”（ 开火（fire）！） “Shoot to kill!”（ 一枪打死！）.

火狐把 ————为什么说火狐(Firefox)是最好的浏览器什么样的浏览器才算是最好的浏览器？为什么说火狐浏览器是最好的浏览器？
百战天虫怎么玩啊?_百度知道 ... specific weapon setting（ 特殊武器设置） fire punch （升龙拳）（F4） dynamite （炸药）（F5）.
学生：救火车（FIRETRUCK） 　　老师的问题终于问完了，校长送了口气，擦了擦额头山的汗说：快上大学去吧。100鲜花 0鸡蛋等级:  …

lj.lj_ly: I don't want an indignant boyfriend on my doorstep breathing fire.
lj.lj_ls: 我可不想要一位愤愤不平的男朋友在我门阶上大发脾气。

lj.lj_ly: his father was preaching fire and brimstone sermons.
lj.lj_ls: 他父亲在作有关地狱磨难的说教。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to give someone permission to begin speaking, typically to ask questions
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［用以表示许可］说吧，讲吧；问吧

lj.lj_ly: "I want to clear up some questions which have been puzzling me." "Fire away.".
lj.lj_ls: "我想弄清一些一直让我困惑的问题。""问吧。"。

jx.jx_en_mean: a powerful sense of ambition or determination
working or functioning at a peak level

jx.jx_cn_mean: (苏格兰，爱尔兰)开始燃烧；着火

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.)stimulate someone to work or act more quickly or enthusiastically
(或 set something on fire)cause to burn; ignite

lj.lj_ly: the film hasn't exactly set the world on fire.
lj.lj_ls: 这部影片并没有真正引起轰动。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to ask someone why they are in such a hurry or state of excitement
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)干吗这么慌张（或兴奋）

jx.jx_en_mean: To start to talk or ask questions.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 开始：开始讲话或问问题

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fȳr (noun), fȳrian supply with material for a fire, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch vuur and German Feuer

encyclopedia.content: 单曲简介 作为BigBang的同门师妹在正式出道之前就备受关注的新人女子组合2NE1，于5月6日发行了她们的首张单曲。 首支单曲《Fire》是由曾经创作了太阳的《只看着我》，严正花的《Disco》等大热歌曲的制作人Teddy负责作词，作曲以及MV指导工作。歌曲中带着浓厚的非洲风情，再加上雷鬼色彩的打击乐伴奏，是一首令人耳目一新的快节奏Hip-Hop歌曲。曲《Fire》，宣布了她们正式进军演艺圈。 此外，在刚刚公开的《Fire》MV中，组合的四位

entry.def: Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning.

example.ex: They saw a big flash and a huge ball of fire reaching hundreds of feet into the sky...
example.tran: 他们看见一道强光和一个巨大的火球冲向数百英尺的高空。

example.ex: Many students were trapped by smoke and fire on an upper floor.
example.tran: 许多学生被浓烟和大火困在了较高的一层上。

entry.def: Fire or a fire is an occurrence of uncontrolled burning which destroys buildings, forests, or other things.

example.ex: 87 people died in a fire at the Happy Land Social Club...
example.tran: 87 人在乐土社交俱乐部的火灾中丧生。

example.ex: A forest fire is sweeping across portions of north Maine this evening...
example.tran: 今晚一场森林大火正席卷缅因州北部的部分地区。

entry.def: A fire is a burning pile of wood, coal, or other fuel that you make, for example to use for heat, light, or cooking.

example.ex: There was a fire in the grate...
example.tran: 壁炉内燃着火。

example.ex: After the killing, he calmly lit a fire to destroy evidence.
example.tran: 杀人后，他镇定地点起火销毁罪证。

entry.def: A fire is a device that uses electricity or gas to give out heat and warm a room.

example.ex: The gas fire was still alight...
example.tran: 燃气取暖器还在烧着。

example.ex: She switched on one bar of the electric fire.
example.tran: 她打开了一片电暖器。

entry.def: When a pot or clay object is fired, it is heated at a high temperature in a special oven, as part of the process of making it.

example.ex: After the pot is dipped in this mixture, it is fired...
example.tran: 陶罐在这一混合料中浸过之后就拿去烧制。

example.ex: I have watched the potters mold, fire and paint their bowls, plates and vases with sacred designs.
example.tran: 我见过制陶工人捏塑、烧制碗碟花瓶，并在上面涂绘各种宗教图案。

entry.def: When the engine of a motor vehicle fires, an electrical spark is produced which causes the fuel to burn and the engine to work.

example.ex: The engine fired and we moved off.
example.tran: 点着引擎后我们就开走了。

entry.def: If a machine is fired with a particular fuel, it operates by means of that fuel.

example.ex: The engines were fired with coal and needed water to keep the steam up.
example.tran: 这些发动机烧煤，并且需要加水以不断产生蒸汽。

entry.tran: 激起;唤起;使充满激情;激发(想象力)
entry.def: If you fire someone with enthusiasm, you make them feel very enthusiastic. If you fire someone's imagination, you make them feel interested and excited.

example.ex: ...the potential to fire the imagination of an entire generation...
example.tran: 能够激发整整一代人想象力的潜能

example.ex: It was Allen who fired this rivalry with real passion...
example.tran: 是艾伦为这场较量注入了激情。

entry.def: You can use fire to refer in an approving way to someone's energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: I went to hear him speak and was very impressed. He seemed so full of fire...
example.tran: 我去听了他的讲话，结果留下了非常深刻的印象。他看上去充满了激情。

example.ex: His punishing schedule seemed to dim his fire at times.
example.tran: 繁忙的日程似乎有时让他精力不济。

entry.def: If an object or substance catches fire, it starts burning.

example.ex: My home catches fire and everything is destroyed...
example.tran: 我家失了火，所有的东西都烧毁了。

example.ex: The aircraft caught fire soon after take-off.
example.tran: 飞机起飞后不久就着火了。

entry.def: If a situation or event catches fire, it begins to be exciting and successful.

example.ex: The play only really catches fire once Aschenbach falls in love.
example.tran: 这部剧直到阿申巴赫堕入情网后才真正开始精彩起来。

entry.tran: 以火攻火;以毒攻毒;以其人之道还治其人之身
entry.def: If you fight fire with fire, you deal with people attacking or threatening you by using similar methods to the ones that they are using.

example.ex: The only way they can deal with crime is to fight fire with fire.
example.tran: 他们打击犯罪的唯一方法就是以牙还牙。

entry.def: If you say that someone has fire in their belly, you are expressing approval of them because they are energetic, enthusiastic, and have very strong feelings.

example.ex: Rocco does not have the same fire in his belly as his father.
example.tran: 罗科不像他父亲那样充满激情。

entry.def: If something is on fire, it is burning and being damaged or destroyed by an uncontrolled fire.

example.ex: The captain radioed that the ship was on fire.
example.tran: 船长发无线电说船着火了。

entry.tran: 热情似火;激动万分;激情澎湃
entry.def: If you say that someone is on fire, you mean they are very enthusiastic, excited, or passionate about something.

example.ex: He was on fire with this marvelous sight.
example.tran: 看到这一令人叹为观止的景象，他激动万分。

entry.def: If you say that someone is playing with fire, you mean that they are doing something dangerous that may result in great harm for them and cause many problems.

example.ex: Schulte warned government and industrial leaders that those who even venture to think about mass layoffs are playing with fire.
example.tran: 舒尔特警告政府和业界领袖说，哪怕只是动动大规模裁员念头的人都是在玩火。

entry.def: If you set fire to something or if you set it on fire, you start it burning in order to damage or destroy it.

example.ex: They set fire to vehicles outside that building...
example.tran: 他们纵火焚烧了停在那幢大楼外的车辆。

example.ex: Lightning set several buildings on fire.
example.tran: 闪电燃着了几栋大楼。

entry.def: If you fire up a machine, you switch it on.

example.ex: Put on a helmet, fire up your engine and head out on the open road.
example.tran: 戴上头盔，发动引擎，开上乡村干道。

entry.def: If you fire someone up, you make them feel very enthusiastic or motivated.

example.ex: The president knows his task is to fire up the delegates.
example.tran: 总统知道自己的任务就是唤起代表的热情。

entry.def: If someone fires a gun or a bullet, or if they fire, a bullet is sent from a gun that they are using.

example.ex: Seven people were wounded when soldiers fired rubber bullets to disperse crowds...
example.tran: 士兵发射橡皮子弹驱散人群时有7个人受了伤。

example.ex: New guns firing high explosive shells were incorporated into the battlefield...
example.tran: 发射高爆弹的新型大炮在战场上得到了使用。

entry.def: You can use fire to refer to the shots fired from a gun or guns.

example.ex: His car was raked with fire from automatic weapons...
example.tran: 他的车遭到自动武器火力的扫射。

example.ex: The two were reportedly killed in an exchange of fire during a police raid.
example.tran: 据报道，这两人在警方突击搜查时发生的交火中被打死。

entry.def: If you fire an arrow, you send it from a bow.

example.ex: He fired an arrow into a clearing in the forest.
example.tran: 他将箭射向林中的一片空地。

entry.def: If you fire questions at someone, you ask them a lot of questions very quickly, one after another.

example.ex: They were bombarded by more than 100 representatives firing questions on pollution.
example.tran: 100多名代表针对污染问题向他们发起连珠炮似的提问。

entry.tran: 猛烈的批评(或抨击、指责)
entry.def: You can use fire to refer to someone's strong criticisms of something.

example.ex: He said they should turn their fire on the Conservative Party instead.
example.tran: 他说他们应该掉转枪口，向保守党开火。

entry.def: If you draw fire from someone, you cause them to shoot at you, for example because they think that you are threatening them.

example.ex: Crowds elsewhere drew fire from troops.
example.tran: 其他地方的人群吸引了军队的火力。

entry.def: If you draw fire for something that you have done, you cause people to criticize you or attack you because of it.

example.ex: The council recently drew fire for its intervention in the dispute...
example.tran: 委员会最近因为介入该起争端而遭到批评。

example.ex: The campaign is drawing fire from anti-smoking advocates.
example.tran: 该活动正受到禁烟倡导者的攻击。

entry.def: If you hang fire, you delay making a decision about something.

example.ex: All I can suggest is that you just hang fire and wait a minute or two and try again...
example.tran: 我的建议就是，先缓一缓，等上一两分钟再试一次。

example.ex: Last week, banks and building societies were hanging fire on interest rates.
example.tran: 上周，银行和建屋互助会推迟了就利率问题作出决定。

entry.tran: 停止射击;等待射击开始
entry.def: If someone holds their fire or holds fire, they stop shooting or they wait before they start shooting.

example.ex: Devereux ordered his men to hold their fire until the ships got closer.
example.tran: 德弗罗命令士兵等船靠近了再开火。

entry.def: If you hold fire in a situation, you delay before taking action.

example.ex: Observers reckon the Bank of England will hold fire until nearer the Budget.
example.tran: 观察家认为英格兰银行会推迟到更加接近预算案出台时再采取措施。

entry.def: If you are in the line of fire, you are in a position where someone is aiming their gun at you. If you move into their line of fire, you move into a position between them and the thing they were aiming at.

example.ex: He cheerfully blows away any bad guy stupid enough to get in his line of fire...
example.tran: 他兴高采烈地将蠢到撞上他枪口的坏家伙全都干掉。

example.ex: The man and his son had been pushed into the line of fire by their captors.
example.tran: 父子俩被那些掳走他们的人推到了枪口前。

entry.def: If you open fire on someone, you start shooting at them.

example.ex: Then without warning, the troops opened fire on the crowd.
example.tran: 接着军队未作警示便向人群开了火。

entry.def: If you return fire or you return someone's fire, you shoot back at someone who has shot at you.

example.ex: The soldiers returned fire after being attacked.
example.tran: 士兵们在遇袭后予以还击。

entry.tran: 遭到射击;受到火力攻击
entry.def: If you come under fire or are under fire, someone starts shooting at you.

example.ex: The Belgians fell back as the infantry came under fire.
example.tran: 步兵团受到火力攻击时比利时人向后撤退。

example.ex: ...sending aid to cities which have been under fire for weeks now.
example.tran: 向那些现已连续数周遭受炮火袭击的城市提供援助

entry.tran: 遭到猛烈批评;受到强烈抨击
entry.def: If you come under fire from someone or are under fire, they criticize you strongly.

example.ex: The president's plan first came under fire from critics who said he hadn't included enough spending cuts.
example.tran: 总统的计划先是遭到批评者的猛烈抨击，他们称开支削减力度不够。

entry.def: If someone wants to say or ask something, you can say 'fire away' as a way of showing that you are ready for them to speak.

example.ex: 'May I ask you something?' — 'Sure. Fire away.'
example.tran: “我可以问你一个问题吗？”——“当然可以。尽管问吧。”

entry.def: If you fire off a shot, you send a bullet or other missile from a gun.

example.ex: A gunman fired off a volley of shots into the air...
example.tran: 持枪歹徒朝天扫射了一排子弹。

example.ex: Cecil now began to panic and fired off two distress rockets.
example.tran: 塞西尔此时开始慌张起来,连忙发射了两枚遇险信号火箭。

entry.tran: (常指作为一系列之一地迅速)发出(信件)，提出(问题),讲出(话语)
entry.def: If you fire off a letter, question, or remark, you send or say it very quickly, often as part of a series.

example.ex: He immediately fired off an angry letter to his ministry colleagues...
example.tran: 他立即给部里的同事发了一封怒气冲冲的信。

example.ex: Ordinary officers fired off a string of angry demands to the government, to improve their pay, status, and conditions.
example.tran: 普通警员愤怒地向政府提出了一连串增加工资、提高地位和改善条件的要求。

entry.def: If an employer fires you, they dismiss you from your job.

example.ex: If he hadn't been so good at the rest of his job, I probably would have fired him...
example.tran: 如果不是因为他在工作的其他方面做得如此之好，我可能就把他开除了。

example.ex: She was sent a box of chocolates along with a letter saying she was fired.
example.tran: 她收到一盒巧克力和一封信，信上说她被解雇了。

means.word_mean: 1. the event of something burning (often destructive);
2. the process of combustion of inflammable materials producing heat and light and (often) smoke;

sentences.sentence: "fire was one of our ancestors' first discoveries"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of firing weapons or artillery at an enemy;

sentences.sentence: "hold your fire until you can see the whites of their eyes"
"they retreated in the face of withering enemy fire"

means.word_mean: 4. a fireplace in which a fire is burning;

sentences.sentence: "they sat by the fire and talked"
"Clinton directed his fire at the Republican Party"

means.word_mean: 6. feelings of great warmth and intensity;
7. once thought to be one of four elements composing the universe (Empedocles)
3. bake in a kiln so as to harden;
6. drive out or away by or as if by fire;

sentences.sentence: "They burned the house and his diaries"

list.explanation: (黑人用语)贬低、打击、损害…名声

example.en: Your behaviour will fire on the whole family.
example.zh: 你的行为会损害全家的名声。

list.explanation: 突然迸发热情、活力，取得一时成功，光耀一时

example.en: When the show takes fire we'll all get rich.
example.zh: 那台戏一走红，我们大家都要发财了。

list.explanation: 发火，激怒，激发，引起欲念

example.en: She fires up at least thing.
example.zh: 她常为一点小事而发火。

example.en: In one word, you shouldn't fire up your opponent.
example.zh: 总之一句话, 你不应当激怒你的对手。
踩足油门，开路吧，哥儿们!

list.explanation: 天不怕地不怕的人(尤指敢批评上司或那些顶撞的人)

example.en: He is a fire-eater who is not afraid of criticizing those in power.
example.zh: 他是个敢于批评那些当权者，天不怕地不怕的人。

auth_sentence.content: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.
auth_sentence.res_content: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.

auth_sentence.content: They did not fire their weapons during the search.
auth_sentence.res_content: They did not fire their weapons during the search.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They did not fire their weapons during the search.

auth_sentence.content: Maximum rate of fire is six rounds per minute.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maximum rate of fire is six rounds per minute.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maximum rate of fire is six rounds per minute.

Sentence.sentence: I suspect the reason is a deep-rooted love of the fire.
Fire was one of the earliest major technological advances for humankind, providing heat, protection, and cooked food (which is much easier to cat and digest)
Human control of fire goes back far enough (over a million years) that evolution could have produced a genetic leaning towards fire as a central aspect of human life.
The picture worsens with each round of El Nino, the unusually warm currents in the Pacific Ocean that drive up temperatures and invariably presage (预示) droughts and fires in the rain forest.
Runaway fires pour even more carbon into the air, which increases temperatures, starting the whole vicious cycle all over again

Each burning season in the Amazon, fires deliberately set by frontier settlers and developers hurl up almost half a billion metric tons of carbon a year, placing Brazil among the top five contributors to greenhouse gases in the world.

sentences.en: Paper is apt to catch fire.

means.word_mean: 火灾; 炉火, 火堆

sentences.en: He ordered his men to fire.
The manager fired Bob because he was always late for work.
sentences.cn: 鲍勃因上班总迟到而被经理解雇。

jushi.english: Her eyes were full of fire.
